module.name: property_condition
module.keywords: module, property, class, possession, characterisation, necessary condition

purpose.P: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the possession of a property by each member of a class of product or activity. Possession of the property is a necessary condition for membership of the class.

note.P: A necessary condition can be deemed by a design activity or predicted by an analysis activity.

purpose.P: A property can be associated with the following:

DD.P: This means that each individual manufactured to the specification has the property.

example.P: exampleThe product specification that is 'widget type XYZ_1234' lasts for more than 10000 load cycles. Each individual product of the type has (or is expected to have) the property that is 'greater than 10000 load cycles to break'.
The product specification that is 'widget type XYZ_1234' has 5 bolt holes. Each individual product of the type has the property that is '5 bolt holes'.

DT.B: a specification for a state during the life of a product

DD.P: This means that each individual in the specified state has the property.

example.P: The state specification that is 'widget type XYZ_1234' in its as-delivered state has a mass of 10 Kg. Each individual widget of the type in that state has the property.
The state specification that is 'widget type XYZ_1234' at maximum power has a particular temperature distribution. Each individual widget of the type in that state has the property.

DT.B: a specification for an activity during the life of a product

DD.P: This means that each individual activity to the specification has the property.

example.P: The activity specification that is 'pump P_101 daily operation' pumps 1000 tonnes of water. Each individual activity that is a daily operation of pump P_101 has the property that is '1000 tonnes of water pumped'.

LI.P: a property condition for a class of product;
a property condition for a class of state of a product;
a property condition for a class of activity.
a possession of an independent property by a physical individual;

note.P: A possession of a property by a physical individual is within the scope of the Possession_of_property application module.

LI.P: the specification of an independent property definition, which may be a condition for a class of physical individual;

note.P: An independent property definition is within the scope of the Independent_property_definition application module.

LI.P: the identification of an independent property definition with respect to a unit of measure.

note.P: The identification of an independent property definition with respect to a unit of measure is within the scope of the Property_identification application module.

uof.name: Property_condition
uof.description: The Property_condition UoF specifies that each member of a class of product or activity and a class possesses a property. Possession of the property is a necessary condition for membership of the class of product or activity.
